abstract: A study finds people who are most glum about the economy are the ones who say that they or someone close to them have "lost a lot of money in the real estate market."
snippet: A study finds people who are most glum about the economy are the ones who say that they or someone close to them have "lost a lot of money in the real estate market."
lead_paragraph: Economists are scrambling to understand why Americans are so pessimistic about the economy. As I describe in an article in Wednesday's paper, a leading theory blames the funk on the collapse in housing prices, which has erased a vast amount of wealth and convinced many Americans that they will never recover financially.

headline.main: What's Behind the Lack of Confidence
